resources.string: Open Source Impelemantion of Lighting Effects for Razer Phone 2
Main service responsible for keeping a privileged shell open and controlling the logo lights
The service could not be started. Please ensure root access is available and that the request is accepted.

To use the ringer animation effect, Logo+ needs the following permissions:

Read phone status and identity:
Allows the app to detect when the phone is ringing

Read call log:
Allows the app to determine which number called so we can apply a specific color per number

If you press OK, the above permissions will be requested. If you press Cancel or deny the permissions the functionality will not be enabled
When this option is toggled on, the passive effect will only run while the phone is unlocked. Notification effects will still run while locked. This can potentially save battery life.

When this option is toggled on, the passive effect will be turned off if, to a degree of certainty, it is determined that the device is currently in a pocket or bag.
The criteria by which this is determined:
	- If the proximity sensor is covered
	- If the ambient light is low
	- If the phone is tilted so that one of its edges is facing downwards(in case the phone is placed face down on a surface, such as a table)
Additionally, these conditions are only checked 5 seconds after the screen turns off

Once the lights are turned off, the phone must be unlocked before they will re-activate. Notification effects are disabled along with the passive effect. This can potentially save battery life.
Please select a value to change...
Automation Instructions to Execute (Tasker variables supported in all fields):
When this option is toggled on, the passive effect will be replaced by a charging animation when the device is plugged in. The animation will change color depending on the current battery level.
Please disable battery optimisations for Logo+ service
There was an error trying to load the custom effect. The effect has not been loaded
The custom effect program was validated successfully. Selecting the Custom Effect effect type will now play the loaded program.
